lx4p

Class LXPVScrollbar

  • java.lang.Object
    • lx4p.LXPVScrollbar

  • public class LXPVScrollbar
extends java.lang.Object
    LXPVScrollbar is a vertical slider type control A LXPVScrollbar should receive both an update and draw message inside a PApplet's draw method. A LXPVScrollbar can hold an OSC address pattern and send and be sent messages reflecting its value.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LXPVScrollbar

        public LXPVScrollbar(float xp,
                     float yp,
                     int sw,
                     int sh,
                     int l)
        Create a vertical scrollbar
        Parameters:
        xp - the x position of the scrollbar (upper left corner)
        yp - the y position of the scrollbar (upper left corner)
        sw - the width of the scrollbar
        sh - the height of the scrollbar
        l - how loose the scrollbar is (how quickly it tracks mouse)

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public boolean update(processing.core.PApplet p)
        Updates the location of the scroll indicator This is called in the Processing Applet's draw() method so that the mouse can be continually tracked
        Parameters:
        p - the Processing Applet
        Returns:
        true if updated

      • draw

        public void draw(processing.core.PApplet p)
        draw the control and its position indicator
        Parameters:
        p - the Processing Applet in which to draw the control

      • draw

        public void draw(processing.core.PApplet p,
                 float level,
                 int indicator_color)
        draw the control, its position indicator and an output indicator
        Parameters:
        p - the Processing Applet in which to draw the control
        level - the output indicator level
        indicator_color - selects the color red or green or blue of the output indicator

      • getValue

        public int getValue()
        getValue represents the location of the control's sliding indicator
        Returns:
        the slider location as an integer in the range 0-255

      • getFloatValue

        public float getFloatValue()
        getFloatValue represents the location of the control's sliding indicator
        Returns:
        the slider location as an integer in the range 0-1.0

      • setValue

        public void setValue(int v,
                     int max,
                     boolean animate)
        setValue adjusts the location of the control's sliding indicator
        Parameters:
        v - the new location of the control's indicator
        max - the value corresponding to the full range of the slider
        animate - will either snap the slider to its new value of move it there through iterations of the update()/draw() loop

      • setValue

        public void setValue(int v,
                     boolean animate)
        setValue adjusts the location of the control's sliding indicator
        Parameters:
        v - the new location of the control's indicator in the range 0-255
        animate - will either snap the slider to its new value of move it there through iterations of the update()/draw() loop

      • constrain

        public float constrain(float val,
                       float minv,
                       float maxv)
        utility function for keeping a value within a range
        Parameters:
        val - the input
        minv - the minimum
        maxv - the maximum
        Returns:
        the constrained value where minv =< out <= maxv

      • getPos

        public float getPos()
        utility function for converting spos to be values between 0 and the total width of the scrollbar
        Returns:
        float representing position

      • sendValueWithOSC

        public void sendValueWithOSC(LXOSC osc,
                             java.net.InetAddress osc_target_address,
                             int osc_target_port)
        Sends the value of the scrollbar using its oscAddress
        Parameters:
        osc - the osc interface used to send the message
        osc_target_address - the target ip address for the message
        osc_target_port - the target port for the message

      • setValueWithOSCMessage

        public boolean setValueWithOSCMessage(LXOSCMessage msg)
        checks to see if msg address pattern matches the scrollbar's osc address and if so, sets scrollbar's value based on msg's float argument (0-1.0)
        Parameters:
        msg - the incoming OSC message object
        Returns:
        true if value was set (allows synchronization to prevent feedback loop)
